meanings.definition: To turn aside suddenly from a straight line or course.
meanings.sent1: The car had to swerve to avoid hitting the animal on the road.
meanings.sent2: The driver had to swerve to avoid a pothole on the street.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made the car swerve by darting across the road unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions made her thoughts swerve in a different direction.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind made the kite swerve in the sky.

meanings.sent1: The cyclist made a quick swerve to avoid the obstacle on the path.
meanings.sent2: The swerve of the ball surprised the goalkeeper during the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful swerve around the furniture made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His decision to quit his job was a sharp swerve in his career path.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected swerve of the conversation caught her off guard.
